title: Textile, 1961–62
dimensions:
Warp: 279cm (110in.). Weft: 89.5cm (35 1/4in.) Both selvedges present.
Pattern: Six units of pattern across width arranged in a straight repeat:           Height of repeat: 33cm (13 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Marion K. Morgan and from General Acquisitions Endowment, Sarah Cooper-Hewitt, and Eleanor G. Hewitt Funds
description: Stripes formed of blotches and curving lines. Blue, cream and gold.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 1961–62.
1961–62. Medium: silk, metallic
Technique: Jacquard-woven. Museum purchase through gift of Marion K. Morgan and from General Acquisitions Endowment, Sarah Cooper-Hewitt, and Eleanor G. Hewitt Funds. 1991-90-17.
